intro: Gynocraterium guianense, commonly known as the Guianan gynocraterium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
